meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After a few days, the plant acclimated to the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent2: She acclimated quickly to the cold weather after moving to the northern city.
meanings.sent3: The fish seemed surprised but acclimated well to the bigger tank.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he acclimated to his new surroundings effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The puppy slowly acclimated to the sounds of the bustling city.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The new student acclimated to the school's schedule within a week.
meanings.sent2: He acclimated to the fast-paced work environment after a few days.
meanings.sent3: The robot acclimated to its programming flawlessly, impressing its creators.
meanings.sent4: She acclimated to the chaos of the kitchen during the dinner rush.
meanings.sent5: The team acclimated to the coach's strict training regimen with determination.
